did.unittitle: Philadelphia Young Men's Bible Society records

bioghist.p: Philadelphia Young Men's Bible Society was established in 1837 and reorganized in 1840. A multi-denominational organization, its goal was the "circulation of the Holy Scriptures, without note or comment" to the residents of Philadelphia and the vicinity. The Committee on Forming Auxiliaries in Sabbath-schools in the City of Liberties was formed in 1837 to establish auxiliaries in Philadelphia churches to aid Society in its work.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of a volume of minutes of the Committee on Forming Auxiliaries in Sabbath-schools in the City of Liberties, 1837-1844. The minutes include a constitution for Sabbath School Auxiliaries; reports of visits to area churches; reports on auxiliaries and election of officers; by-laws of the committee; reports of moneys received; and copies of correspondence.
